;陈清木，新加坡执政党人民行动党 (PAP) 的著名批评者，周日在共和国总统竞选中支持了这位局外人候选人，称另一位亲建制国家元首将违背国家利益。

;

;此举可能对陈健联来说是一剂强心剂。一家保险公司的前首席执行官在选举中被视为局外人，而前人民行动党部长尚达曼和强大的国家投资者 GIC 的前高管黄国松也参与了竞选。观察人士称，66 岁的尚达曼最有可能赢得 9 月 1 日的选举。

;

;陈清木 (Tan Cheng Bock)，83 岁，坚定的人民行动党议员，在 2010 年代脱离建制派，是第一位参加总统竞选的人作为局外人当选，随后组建了自己的政党。

;

;统治集团“总是给不和他们在一起的人贴上能力较差的标签”，但要靠选民来消除这种想法，谭程博克周日与 75 岁的陈健联一起在媒体吹风会上说道。

;

;随着总统竞选的升温，新加坡的秘密储备成为焦点

;

;陈还提到了人民行动党在2016 年收紧了总统职位的资格标准，这是一个很大程度上是礼仪性的职位，对共和国财政储备的使用和关键官僚的任命拥有一些监管权。

;

;更新后的规则意味着“你总是会得到一些人”陈清木表示，但重要的是，公民有机会投票选出一位“非常独立”的总统。

;

;总统独立于政府是至关重要的。鉴于该职位作为国家庞大储备的看门人的角色，该职位受到了执政机构的重视。

;

;陪同两人的还有前高级公务员、现为反对党新加坡民主党成员的陈治世 (Tan Jee Say)。

;

;陈健联、陈清木和陈如斯是 2011 年四选一总统选举的候选人，总共获得了 65% 的选票。

;

;那次竞选由人民行动党前高级部长陈庆炎 (Tony Tan Keng Yam) 的领先优势为 0.35%。鉴于人民行动党内部人士很少与自 1959 年以来统治国家的政党分裂，陈清木在那次选举中的候选资格被视为该国政治历史上的一个重要里程碑。

;

;新加坡进步党 (PSP)由陈清木 (Tan Cheng Bock) 共同创立的公司在 2020 年大选期间首次亮相的强劲表现令专家们感到惊讶。作为此次民意调查的“最佳输家”，该党在立法院拥有两名非选区议员。

;

;陈如斯和陈清木均表示，他们以个人身份支持陈健联，因为根据选举规则，政党不得支持候选人。

;

;被问及支持陈健联是否会影响社会党的选举机会时，陈清木表示，每一个决定都是有风险的。不过，他强调，他的支持并不反映该党的立场，并表示选民必须警惕将总统民意调查与政党政治问题混为一谈。

;

;陈健联表示，他感谢他的支持他在 2011 年总统选举中的两个竞争对手。他还重申了竞选活动的关键信息，即确保下一任总统是真正独立于人民行动党的人。

;

;在他发表一些旧的社交媒体帖子后，这位总统候选人的竞选活动因一些争议而蒙上阴影。他在公众场合看到的“漂亮女孩”的言论引起了一个有影响力的女权组织的批评。

;

;他在竞选期间的言论也引起了一些人的关注，选举官员指示他的团队修改了他演讲的一部分本周早些时候进行了一次电视广播，因为其中包含有关总统角色的“不准确之处”。

;

;包括现任总统哈莉玛·雅各布在内的所有前任总统都与人民行动党有着密切的联系。

;

;尚达曼被视为领跑者的人民行动党前高级部长，强烈反驳了由于他在党内的长期记录而无法胜任这一职务的说法。

;

;第三位候选人是黄国（Ng Kok）。宋先生的竞选活动也以他独立于执政党为基础。

; Sun, 27 Aug 2023 13:50:02 +0800 China’s anti-corruption campaign is shaking up healthcare. Will it spur innovation?https://www.scmp.com/news/china/science/article/3232257/chinas-anti-corruption-campaign-shaking-healthcare-will-it-spur-innovation?utm_source=rss_feed

;中国的医疗保健系统正处于最大规模的反腐败打击之中，自今年年初以来，全国各地已有 160 多名医院院长被拘留。

;

;这项行动旨在根除受回扣困扰的系统中普遍存在的腐败行为，希望提供更好的护理和更具创新性的医疗服务。行业。

;

;人们感兴趣的一个主要领域是生物制药行业，人们担心与美国关系的恶化可能会限制中国获得药品和其他健康相关产品——就像它所做的那样。< /p>;

;国家卫健委本月早些时候表示，“加强是推动医药行业高质量发展的重要内容”。

;

;但这次打击行动引发了人们的争论：确实可以帮助解决中国医药行业一些长期存在的问题，例如研发投入不足。

;

;不到10年前，无效药或仿制药占据了中国医药市场的最大部分。

;

;由于这些药物非常相似，制药公司依靠营销来推广它们。 “营销”可以是合法的，例如会议或研讨会，也可以是非法的，例如付钱给医生开更多处方。

;

;在二月份发布的一项研究中，北京大学和哈佛大学的研究人员发现，在上法庭的医疗腐败案件中，绝大多数涉及贿赂。

;

;研究人员检查了2013年至2019年中国3546起公共医疗腐败案件，发现存在超过三分之二的案件。

;

;大约 80% 的受贿者是医疗保健提供者，而大多数给予回扣的人是医疗设备和消耗品的供应商。

;

;“非常严重”：中国加大力度努力消除医疗部门腐败

;

;由于大量资金投入“营销”，用于研发的资金越来越少。长期以来，中国医药企业的研发投入与营销成本相比偏低，一直被诟病。

;

;据中国新闻网站界面报道，A股市场上市的中国医药企业的销售费用合计约为2022 年将达到 2800 亿元人民币（384.7 亿美元），约为研发费用的 2.6 倍。

;

;最大的区别是中药制药公司 - 其销售费用占运营成本的四分之一，而研发投入只占3%。

;

;生物科技公司Neoland首席执行官王浩然表示，他相信从长远来看，只有真正投入生物科学并开发出最好的医疗方法和设备的公司才能成为未来的公司。 ” ，为什么企业愿意多年来在研发上投入大量资金并承担不确定性的风险？”

;

;生物技术产业集团 Tonacea 创始人程增江表示，减少医疗行业腐败不会自动带来更多创新，并表示根本原因仍然很强大。

;

;问题在于回到 20 世纪 90 年代，当时中国开始削减资金，同时坚持要求医院限制服务价格和加成。

;

;因此，许多医院开始向患者收取不必要的处方和服务费用，以弥补不足解决公共资金短缺问题。与此同时，制药公司之间的竞争加剧，所有这些都使卫生部门腐败的时机成熟。

;

;根据 2 月份发表的研究，公立医院的低工资也是卫生服务提供者贿赂的主要驱动因素之一。程说，鉴于医疗服务价格扭曲和财政补贴有限，即使是独特的药物也可能涉及回扣销售，因为医生有动力从“灰色”来源补充收入，例如药品和设备制造商。

;

;但一些观察人士表示，即使中国市场上的所有药品都是尖端且高度创新的，也无法杜绝不道德的销售行为。

;

;“即使是‘一流’药物也需要商业推广；清华大学药学院教授丁胜说：“这是所有产品的基本原则。”

;

;他指出，即使是全球制药巨头有时也存在营销不当行为。

;

;程对此表示同意，并表示“海外医疗公司在某种程度上已经试行了回扣文化”。

;

;2012年，习近平主席发起了一场针对各个行业的反腐败运动。一年后，跨国制药公司在中国被发现卷入贿赂丑闻，其中包括葛兰素史克和阿斯利康。两者都生产许多一流的药物和疫苗。

;

;哈佛大学陈曾熙公共卫生学院教授 Winnie Yip 表示，将创新机构与医疗产品制造商和销售商分开将是一种方法开始看到反腐败与产业创新之间的联系。

;

;如果研究公司涉嫌贿赂，打击腐败将产生明显的结果。

;

;但是促进制药公司的研发丁表示，这是一项复杂的挑战，指望反腐败运动成为灵丹妙药是不现实的。

;

;中国反腐监管机构在医疗保健突击行动中逮捕了 160 名医院老板

;

;尽管如此，行业还是取得了一些进展。

;

;中国学者群体在2022年发表的一篇论文发现，经过二十多年的改革，中国的药品监管机构已经成为一个更加高效、科学和临床的监管机构。

;

;例如，2016年推出的仿制药质量一致性评价要求显着提高了仿制药的标准，排除了多余的仿制药。

;

; 2017年，中国还加入了国际协调理事会，为中国药品注册技术要求与全球标准接轨铺平了道路。

;

;这些努力有助于推动国内创新。

;

;这些努力有助于促进国内创新。 >;

;例如，治疗——中国生物技术发展最活跃的领域——已经取得了重大进展。 2018 年开始蓬勃发展，截至 2021 年 5 月已有 8 个产品获得批准。

;

;尽管同意打击腐败可能带来的积极影响，但中国医疗健康创新平台研究院院长蔡约翰（John Cai）上海智库警告说，需要详细的政策和法律来实施真正的变革。

;

;“一刀切的做法可能会对医药创新产生不利影响，”蔡说。例如，它可能会阻碍旨在改善医生和制药公司之间沟通的守法和必要的促销活动。

;

;为了刺激生物技术行业，程补充道，中国政策制定者必须创造一个更可持续的环境，使确保创新产品利润丰厚，并不断鼓励公司投资研发。

;法国总统埃马纽埃尔·马克龙上个月在斯里兰卡进行了短暂但历史性的停留，这表明法国希望为中国、印度和西方国家之间争夺印太地区影响力的大国斗争提供“替代方案”。

;

;马克龙的访问正值法国和斯里兰卡建交75周年之际两国关系已持续多年，而且两国都致力于加强发展援助、海上安全和贸易等领域的合作。

;

;分析人士表示，两国日益增长的友谊是由共同利益驱动的，斯里兰卡也希望避免被在努力解决其巨大的债务负担时，它“陷入”了争夺地区影响力的敌对大国之间。

;

;斯里兰卡正处于严重经济和人道主义危机的阵痛之中，“严重衰退、高通胀、资源枯竭”。储备和不可持续的公共债务”，国际货币基金组织表示。

;

;“斯里兰卡不仅在经济上处于困境，而且由于各国之间的战略竞争而使地区环境日益紧张，使情况变得更加复杂。美国和平研究所客座专家尼兰蒂·萨马拉纳亚克 (Nilanthi Samaranayake) 表示，马克龙之行表明巴黎希望被视为其他大国的替代者，马蒂厄·德罗恩 (Mathieu Droin) 表示， ”西方或美国；他补充说，法国向斯里兰卡等国家传达的信息是，“如果国家不愿意，就不必选择或选边站队” .

;

;西方官员直奔印度太平洋地区以抗衡中国的影响力

;

;斯里兰卡与法国的关系可以追溯到很久以前，自 2004 年毁灭性海啸以来就得到了法国的援助。

;

;斯里兰卡与法国的关系可以追溯到很久以前。在斯里兰卡的危机中，法国已成为继中国、印度和日本之后的第四大债权国。根据斯里兰卡政府财政部数据，截至3月份，其欠法国的金额总计4.28亿美元。除此之外，据法国欧洲和外交部称，法国政府的援助和发展机构 AFD 在过去十年中已为项目承诺了 6.8 亿美元。

;

;5 月，Expertise France 成立，该机构成立作为法国发展署的一部分，法国开发署与欧盟合作在斯里兰卡启动了“绿色政策对话机制”，帮助其发展“绿色和循环经济，确保其长期宏观经济稳定”。 7 月份，法国开发署、欧盟和世界银行还批准了一项 1,060 万美元赠款，以加强斯里兰卡的公共财政管理。

;

;根据斯里兰卡政府的官方数据，斯里兰卡欠双边债权人 71 亿美元，其中欠中国 30 亿美元，其次是欠巴黎俱乐部 24 亿美元，欠印度 16 亿美元。

;

;政府还需要与海外私人债权人重新谈判超过 120 亿美元的欧元债券债务以及 27 亿美元的其他商业贷款。

;

;今年 4 月，法国与印度和日本合作，还宣布为斯里兰卡债权人建立一个共同平台，以协调和帮助科伦坡重组债务。

;

;萨马拉纳亚克表示，与此同时，与巴黎加强经济联系可能有助于科伦坡未来改善财政状况。 “斯里兰卡需要增加出口以创造外汇来源并摆脱经济危机。欧盟的普惠制附加版对于帮助斯里兰卡的市场准入至关重要。”她补充说，法国可以通过解决欧盟的任何关切来推动这一进程。

;

;

;

;法国已呼吁CSIS 的德罗因表示，印太地区是“优先事项”，但考虑到美国、日本和印度等其他国家一直在积极扩大在该地区的影响力，现在“有点晚了”。

;

;“马克龙此行的目的是为了弥补失去的时间，并跟上这些大国的步伐，”德罗因说。 “这次访问标志着法国对该地区态度的转变。”

;

;中国加强在印度洋的经济、外交和军事存在也激发了法国对该地区的兴趣。

;

; >;

;四月份在美国众议院作证时，卡内基捐赠基金南亚项目研究员达莎娜·巴鲁阿 (Darshana Baruah) 表示，中国是在印度洋六个岛国均设有大使馆的唯一主要参与者– 斯里兰卡、马尔代夫、毛里求斯、塞舌尔、马达加斯加和科摩罗。中国一直在亚丁湾进行海军部署，打击海盗行为，其军舰也经常出现在印度洋地区。

;

;德罗因表示，北京的行动尤其让巴黎感到震惊。

;< p>;“中国是这次访问的一个重要因素。法国由于其领土（在印度-太平洋地区），处于非常有利的位置来观察中国日益增强的自信，特别是在南太平洋地区。”他指的是留尼汪岛、法属波利尼西亚和新喀里多尼亚。

;

;

;

;随着法国寻求增强其在该地区的影响力，斯里兰卡也依靠法国的积极存在来帮助其克服一个尴尬的困境：对邻国印度的依赖日益增加。

;

;过去几年，印度通过信贷额度、货币互换协议和延期进口付款向斯里兰卡提供了约 40 亿美元的援助。斯里兰卡议会议长马欣达·亚帕·阿贝瓦德纳上个月表示，新德里的援助“拯救”了科伦坡，使其免于金融危机中的“大屠杀”。

;

;然而，分析人士表示，斯里兰卡对其日益增长的依赖感到越来越不安。

;

;“科伦坡有人呼吁与印度进行更强有力的接触，但这并不意味着印度将是斯里兰卡想要依赖的唯一参与者，”Aditya Gowdara Shivamurthy 说，总部位于新德里的观察家研究基金会战略研究项目的初级研究员。

;

;“印度的援助无疑帮助了斯里兰卡，但它也让科伦坡产生了一种感觉，即必须对印度的援助更加敏感”安全利益和印度的担忧。它不能像以前那样认为印度是理所当然的。”Shivamurthy 补充道。

;

;斯里兰卡一直在涉及其利益的问题上展示其独立性。上周，印度宣布加入区域全面经济伙伴关系贸易集团，德里于 2019 年 11 月退出该贸易集团，声称这损害了印度的利益。斯里兰卡也在考虑与中国达成自由贸易协定，这一进展引起了印度的关注。

;

;分析人士表示，与巴黎加强接触将有助于缓解科伦坡的困境。

;

;法国已斯里兰卡还热衷于加强其在该地区的海上存在，由于其战略位置，斯里兰卡正在成为该地区的关键参与者。在过去的两个月里，两艘法国海军舰艇访问了科伦坡港进行补给活动。

;

;一家由美国企业家联合创立的中国会议空间初创企业2018 年，该公司的规模在 Covid-19 大流行期间增加了两倍，尽管中国经济形势日益严峻，与美国的关系也日益恶化，但该公司仍寻求在中国主要城市扩张。

;

;总部位于上海的 White Space，提供按需举办活动和会议的场地已从 2019 年的 4 个增加到今年年初的 12 个。联合创始人兼首席执行官 Barbara Ex 在最近的一次采访中告诉《华盛顿邮报》，该公司目前计划每个季度在北京、深圳和杭州等一线城市增加至少一个办公地点。

;

; WeWork 等空间提供商为用户提供灵活的办公桌和私人办公室使用权限，White Space 专注于可容纳 10 至 150 人进行培训、销售会议和团队建设活动的较大房间。

;

;该公司是Ex 是一名资深咨询人士，自 2005 年以来一直在中国工作，其中包括在计算机巨头担任过一年高管，他表示，希望吸引计划减少房地产足迹、因此需要预算友好的外部空间来举办协作活动的企业。联想在北京。

;

;“经济放缓实际上支持了我们的模式，因为人们正在寻找尽可能节约的方法，”Ex 说。 “他们仍然想见面，但也许他们不想花钱住五星级酒店。”

;

;由于消费者和投资者信心低迷，中国经济复苏未达到预期，这是中国经济增速最大的一次跌幅。出口三年来下滑，地方政府债务和房地产风险不断加深。

;

;自2020年以来，受新冠疫情和新规出台的双重打击，中国房地产开发商一直面临流动性紧缩的困境中国最大的私营房地产开发商碧桂园控股表示，其未能支付几笔债券，引发了人们对其困境可能蔓延至同行和更广泛领域的担忧，最近，危机进一步加深。中国金融市场。

;

;Ex表示，White Space与房东分享收入，而不是按照市场价格向他们支付租金，在过去三年里，由于Covid-19感染浪潮和上海的封锁，White Space也面临着挑战。

;

;根据 Ex 的说法，自运营第一个月到 2020 年 1 月，这家初创公司已录得利润和正现金流。但随着疫情爆发，该公司不得不终止与一位房东的合作关系，后者改变了主意并要求全额租金，她说。

;

;“无论是在 2020 年还是去年，都有一些存在主义的时刻 [问题]，”Ex 说道。 “我不知道这家公司是否能渡过难关，我们可能会在四个月内破产。”

;

;但是 White Space 能够在 2020 年和 2021 年保持运营，并获得更多分数埃克斯说，与房东建立伙伴关系。她说，今年中国取消了所有疫情限制后，该公司恢复了盈利能力和正现金流，并能够解决去年延迟付款的问题。

;

;随着世界逐渐摆脱最糟糕的时期，然而，在大流行期间，全球共享空间行业正处于十字路口。行业巨头 WeWork 在 2021 年上市前在私募市场的估值一度达到 470 亿美元，该公司本月早些时候警告称，随着需求下滑，其继续运营的能力存在“重大疑问”。

;

;WeWork 曾截至上周，其市值还不足 3 亿美元。

;

;美中地缘政治紧张局势加剧，加上多年的疫情限制，也使 Ex 成为留在中国的美国企业家数量不断减少的一员。 .

;

;投资者对政治气候的担忧“肯定减缓了我们的增长”，Ex 表示。尽管如此，地方政府对待空白空间的态度“与任何其他小企业一模一样”，该公司的联合创始人是中国公民，而且该公司并未感受到中美关系日趋恶化的任何影响。 Ex 表示，White Space 目前拥有约 3,000 个活跃客户，其中大多数是中型公司，涵盖 70 多个行业。

;

;中国电信设备巨头华为技术有限公司、全球咨询公司埃森哲和中国房地产经纪公司链家都是White Space服务的最大客户。

;

;该公司的下一个主要项目是一个方便预订的小程序，预计将进行测试Ex 表示，9 月发布，10 月发布。

;Two teenagers were among 13 people arrested for their suspected involvement in banking-related malware scams targeting Android users.

;

;The 15-year-old individuals were arrested alongside seven men and four women aged 17 to 25, said the police in a news release on Saturday.

;

;All of them were arrested during an anti-scam enforcement operation conducted by the police between August 14 and August 25.

;

;Two other women, aged 29 and 39, and another 15-year-old teenager are assisting with investigations.

;

;Preliminary police investigations revealed that the 13 suspects had allegedly facilitated the scam cases by relinquishing their bank accounts. Some of them also relinquished their internet banking credentials or disclosed their Singpass credentials for monetary gain.

;

;Cases of malware being used to compromise Android mobile devices have been on the rise since January, police said.

;

;This results in unauthorised transactions made from the victims' bank accounts even though they did not reveal their internet banking credentials, one-time passwords or Singpass credentials to anyone.

;

;In such cases, the victims responded to advertisements on social media platforms and were later instructed by the scammers to download a malicious Android Package Kit from non-official app stores to facilitate the purchases, leading to malware being installed on the victims' mobile devices.

;

;The scammers then convince the victims via phone calls or text messages to turn on accessibility services on their Android phones. This allows the scammers to take full control of the mobile devices.

;

;“This means that the scammers can log every keystroke and steal banking credentials stored in the phones and allows them to remotely log in to the victims' banking apps, add money mules as payees, raise payment limits and transfer monies out to money mules,” said the police.

;

;Singapore police probe 18 bomb threats, including at government buildings

;

;The scammers can further delete SMS and email notifications of the bank transfers to cover their tracks.

;

;The police advised members of the public to not click on suspicious links, scan unknown QR codes or download mobile apps from third-party websites.

;

;“These unverified apps may contain malware, which can severely compromise the security of mobile devices.

;

;“Always be wary of any requests for Singpass and banking credentials or money transfers and attractive offers that sound too good to be true,” the police said.

;

;They added that people are reminded to download apps from official app stores and are advised to turn on security settings to protect their devices.

;

;Earlier in August, the police arrested 10 people including a 16-year-old for their suspected involvement in banking-related malware scams targeting Android users.

;

;Also in June this year, nine people were arrested for the same scam, with victims losing more than S$221,000 (US$164,000), including more than S$114,000 in CPF savings.

;

;Police investigations into the latest round of arrests are ongoing.

;

;Those convicted of acquiring benefits from criminal conduct may be jailed for up to 10 years, fined up to S$500,000, or both.

;

;For deceiving banks into opening bank accounts that were not meant for their own use and relinquishing bank account login details, offenders face a three-year jail term, a fine, or both under the Penal Code. They may also face charges under the Computer Misuse Act.

;

;For disclosing their Singpass credentials, offenders may face three years' jail, a fine of up to S$10,000 or both.

; Sun, 27 Aug 2023 10:20:02 +0800 Singapore’s reserves in spotlight as PM Lee Hsien Loong makes rare comments about ‘nest egg’ ahead of presidential pollhttps://www.scmp.com/week-asia/economics/article/3232370/singapores-reserves-spotlight-pm-lee-hsien-loong-makes-rare-comments-about-nest-egg-ahead?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.27 09:30;
;;

;Since the starting pistol for Singapore's September 1 presidential race went off, much of the news surrounding the three men vying for the job has centred on their messages of being independent, non-partisan and a check on government.

;

;Yet the biggest issue they have to grapple with if they are elected president is the city state's vast financial reserves.

;

;Painstakingly accrued since the days of the late founding prime minister Lee Kuan Yew's time in power, the city state is currently believed to have well over S$1 trillion (US$737.5 billion) in reserves, with the actual amount a state secret.

;

;A portion of up to half of the annual returns from the sum, known as the net investment returns contribution (NIRC), constitutes the second-biggest contributor to the government budget. The principal sum, meanwhile, gives the republic substantial financial firepower in times of crisis – such as during the Covid-19 pandemic – without needing to borrow funds.

;

;When and how much of the reserves can be unlocked is within the purview of the president, in agreement with a Council of Presidential Advisers.

;

;Observers say this system, operational since 1991, is reflective of the ruling People's Action Party's (PAP) anxiety that the reserves could be “raided” for short-term gain if a populist government were to take power in a freak election.

;

;As Singapore heads to next week's vote – its first contested presidential election in over a decade – Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong and other high-level officials have given the public a rare, in-depth look at how the reserves are managed, what they are made up of and why their value must be kept a secret in a series of interviews.

;

;“The reserves are something which is precious, which we have inherited, because our forefathers who were not wealthier than us, but who in good years felt that they should put some money aside, save for the future, provide for their children and grandchildren,” Lee said in an interview with national broadcaster CNA.

;

;The reserves are much like a “little nest egg” and crucial to sustain the city state – which has no “oil, tin, gold, or diamonds” – through “a very tough spot”, he added.

;

;Singapore's president is not an alternative power centre: Tharman Shanmugaratnam

;

;The government has in the past fiercely rejected the opposition's calls to spend a greater proportion of the reserves' returns, which are managed by state investors GIC and Temasek, as well as its central bank, labelling such suggestions as disadvantageous to future generations of Singaporeans.

;

;At present, up to 50 per cent of the long-term annual returns of the reserves can be used as the NIRC component of the government budget, with the remaining 50 per cent saved as part of the principal amount.

;

;The three presidential hopefuls – Tharman Shanmugaratnam, an economist by training and a former senior minister; Ng Kok Song，拥有数十年管理州政府投资组合的经验； and Tan Kin Lian, ex-chief of insurer NTUC Income – have taken great pains to persuade the 2.7 million-strong electorate that they have what it takes to protect the state's reserves.

;

;Local political analysts say the government's decision to peel back the curtain on the reserves weeks ahead of the September 1 vote is likely down to its wish that voters pick the person best suited to act as the reserves' steward.

;

;While election rules bar the PAP from endorsing a candidate, Tharman – for years Prime Minister Lee's top economic tsar – is seen as the ruling establishment's choice to succeed the incumbent president, Halimah Yacob.

;

;“Amid all the discussion about the president's independence and custodial roles, I suppose Lee and his cabinet wanted to clarify how the current administration sees the use and management of reserves to the public,” said Chong Ja Ian, a political scientist at the National University of Singapore.

;

;He said the recent peek behind the curtain could have provided an opportunity to defend the current use of the reserves, which some critics have slammed as “inefficient” and involves “over-saving”.

;

;“The PAP has historically been eager to shape the narrative surrounding the use of reserves,” he said.

;

;While both Tharman and Ng, who are widely viewed as having links to the establishment, have agreed with the government's cautious approach to the reserves, Tan is the only candidate who has questioned whether the government has been “saving too much” in local media interviews.

;

;Tan did not elaborate on how he intends to manage the reserves, but suggested he hoped to alleviate some of the cost pressures faced by Singaporeans. He echoed calls by critics who have urged the government not to go ahead with its goods and services tax hike increase of 1 percentage point to 9 per cent, set to take effect next year.

;

;“I intend to work with the government to ensure that the past reserves are used wisely for the benefit of our current and future generations,” Tan said during a national broadcast on Thursday.

;

;Singapore lucky to have Tharman and me running for president: Ng Kok Song

;

;Meanwhile, his opponents have echoed Lee's anxieties about “frittering” the reserves away, with both having spent years being in the institutions that oversaw the same reserves that they intend on protecting if elected.

;

;Ng said during a recent interview with This Week in Asia: “I hope to tone down some of the misperceptions [out there] … that the government is not doing enough, we can spend more. So I think the debate is being nourished by more explanation, such as what the prime minister has done.

;

;“If I'm the president, I understand exactly everything that the prime minister said. But I don't think enough Singaporeans understand that.”

;

;Critics have called for greater transparency about the reserves, but Tharman, who was finance minister from 2007 to 2015, defended the government's approach in his interview with This Week in Asia. The official position is that the size of the reserves must be withheld to prevent speculative attacks on the Singapore dollar.

;

;Tharman said in the interview that besides the prime minister, there were others who knew the value of reserves, which allowed for “some checks and balances”.

;

;“I think we've explained repeatedly why it's not a very sensible strategy nationally, to reveal to the world, you have the full size of your defences. I think that argument remains valid,” he said.

;

;Singapore kick-starts presidential campaigning amid 'pretty girls' controversy

;

;Former president Ong Teng Cheong had used his position in 1993 to stress-test the system, and prompted the government to come up with a framework that addressed these issues, which has since gone through “constant fine-tuning and improvement”, Tharman said.

;

;The government then released a white paper on principles for determining and safeguarding the reserves, which also required agencies to provide the president with regular financial reports.

;

;Ong supported the decision to amend the constitution to save 50 per cent of the investment income while spending the other half.

;

;In the 2000s, the government settled on the net investment income and net investment returns framework, otherwise known as the NII and NIR, respectively, as a means of improving the system.

;

;The current government's philosophy has not changed since that of the early founding fathers and Tharman, the front runner to win Friday's presidential election, is unlikely to chart a different course from his predecessors.

;

;“Our reserves were hard-earned, over generations,” he said during this week's national broadcast. “它们反映了我们创始领导人的独特远见，以及几代新加坡人为更美好、更安全的未来而储蓄的意愿。它们在极其不确定的未来中为新加坡带来了显着的优势。 They must be made to last.”

; Sun, 27 Aug 2023 09:50:01 +0800 China sees boom in ‘love brain’ advice industry for the heartbroken which offers companions to scold and comfort clientshttps://www.scmp.com/news/people-culture/trending-china/article/3232055/china-sees-boom-love-brain-advice-industry-heartbroken-which-offers-companions-scold-and-comfort?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.27 09:00;
;;

;A chat support service for people who are so fixated on romance that they have lost the ability to have a rational perspective on their relationship is booming in China.

;

;The condition, which has become known as lian ai nao, or love brain, has spawned a myriad of online shops offering “chatting” companions who will “berate and wake up a person” suffering from it.

;

;According to The Paper news site, some online outlets earn up to 70,000 yuan (US$9,600) a month from providing the service.

;

;A woman, surnamed Lu, whose online shop offers chatting companion service, said the demand for help dealing with “love brain” is surging and accounts for half of her business.

;

;She said many customers were inspired to seek help after seeing the recently released Lost in the Stars blockbuster.

;

;The film is about a woman from a wealthy family whose penniless husband murders her to pay off debts from a gambling addiction. Many filmgoers were deeply affected by the tragedy and the fact it was caused by the blind trust in love.

;

;“Most of my customers are aged between 20 and 25, and 98 per cent are women,” Lu said.

;

;“But I should say they are not yet deeply affected by a serious love brain.他们仍然意识到他们需要摆脱这种状况。 They hope to come out of their love fixation.”

;

;Lu described one customer who was angry with her boyfriend because he often replied to her messages hours after receiving them. The woman kept on wondering what he was doing and why he did not respond to her in a timely manner.

;

;“This girl ordered our service and hoped we could persuade her to be independent and not to rely on her boyfriend too much,” said Lu.

;

;Such chat consultations cost around 10 yuan (US$1.4) for five minutes, 20 yuan for 10 minutes, and 40 yuan for 20 minutes.

;

;Lu said her staff working as chat companions for customers must have high emotional intelligence. Sometimes the companion will become friends with their customers, but no romance has arisen between staff and customers so far.

;

;“When the market is good, my shop's profit will reach as high as 2,000 yuan (US$275) a day,” said Lu.

;

;One of her customers praised the advice she received.

;

;“Little Sister's guidance is effective.她一针见血。 I realised that what I did before was a waste of time and money,” the woman said.

;

;Another satisfied customer said: “Thanks Little Brother for listening to my story patiently.你结束了我的困惑。 I was also soothed by your gentle voice.”

;

;Videos scolding people with love brain have also been trending on video platform Douyin.

;

;“I want to ask those who get down on their knees to beg their ex to be with them again, 'Do you regard yourself as a human being? Do you respect your dignity?'” said an influencer known as Long Jing Zhu in a love brain video with 190,000 likes and 80,000 comments.

;

;She added: “Other people are not obligated to love you. If you don't love yourself, you are belittling yourself.”

;

;Love brain services have become the subject of widespread discussion on mainland social media.

;

;“I think I have a clear mindset.我明白你说的。 But I just can't stop missing him,” said one online observer.

;

;“I don't think people with love brain can be woken up,” said another.

; Sun, 27 Aug 2023 09:20:02 +0800 East Asia’s ‘seismic shift’: why China sees the Camp David summit as the start of a de facto military alliancehttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/diplomacy/article/3232167/east-asias-seismic-shift-why-china-sees-camp-david-summit-start-de-facto-military-alliance?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.27 09:00;
;;

;As Washington inches closer to a de facto military alliance with Tokyo and Seoul, pundits have warned of the destabilising impact it could have on the regional power balance amid fears over escalating tensions between China and the US.

;

;US President Joe Biden hailed the “new era” of a close security partnership between the three powers at a landmark trilateral summit held at Camp David over the weekend. While Biden also insisted the summit was not targeted at Beijing, a joint statement from the three powers voiced concerns about China's “dangerous and aggressive behaviour” in the South China Sea and its policy towards Taiwan.

;

;On Monday, Chinese foreign ministry spokesman Wang Wenbin lashed out at the summit, which he said had “smeared and attacked China” and was “a deliberate attempt to sow discord between China and our neighbours”. He compared the partnership to other US-led alliances such as Aukus with Britain and Australia and the Quad with India, Japan and Australia.

;

;“We see two trajectories in the Asia-Pacific [region] today,” Wang said. “一是努力推进团结合作和经济一体化。 The other features attempts to stoke division and confrontation and revive the Cold War mentality.”

;

;Seong-hyon Lee, a senior fellow at George HW Bush Foundation for US-China Relations, said by formalising the cooperation between the countries, the Camp David summit marked “a de facto military alliance without explicitly stating so”.

;

;“We are witnessing a seismic shift in the East Asian security landscape that we haven't seen for the last 100 years,” he said, noting that Biden, South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol and Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida agreed to hold summits and joint military drills annually.

;

;The trio also agreed to set up a new hotline to share military intelligence, pledged to share real-time data on North Korea's missile launches and discussed measures to de-risk global supply chains from exposure to China.

;

;Shi Yinhong, a professor of international affairs at Renmin University in Beijing, said although the summit fell short of announcing a military alliance, it marked a new stage of intensifying strategic coordination between Washington and China's neighbours.

;

;In recent years, he said, both the US and Japan had stepped up “extensive, in-depth and specific” preparations for a possible conflict with China over Taiwan, which Beijing sees as a runaway province that must be reunited, by force if necessary. He added both countries had also implemented supply chain restructuring to further squeeze China's strategic and economic operating space.

;

;“Under these circumstances, the establishment of a permanent military and economic security framework against China by the United States, Japan and South Korea was formally put on their joint agenda through effective coordination, and thus there was a Camp David meeting,” Shi said.

;

;The latest Camp David deal is just more US-allied overkill

;

;For Beijing, the most important takeaway from the summit was the high degree of coordination on China-related issues between the three powers, against the backdrop of the Biden administration's “comprehensive suppression of China”, said Zhu Feng, a professor of international affairs at Nanjing University.

;

;Of the three nations, Zhu said South Korea's rapprochement with Japan and its change of heart on sensitive issues such as the South China Sea and Taiwan on Yoon's watch were particularly unexpected for Beijing.

;

;“While the US, Japan and South Korea have established a tighter trilateral alignment on regional security issues, the summit also meant that Seoul has basically ended its years-long policy of maintaining a balance between the US and China,” Zhu said.

;

;“The fact that South Korea has effectively picked a side in the US-China rivalry will have a very important impact on China's peripheral security and its strategic competition with the US in East Asia.”

;

;Unlike Japan, South Korea used to be reluctant to side with the US on maritime disputes and cross-strait tensions. But since Yoon took office over a year ago, Seoul has sought closer military ties with Washington, improved strained ties with Tokyo and increasingly aligned itself with the two countries on China issues.

;

;Beijing recently stepped up pressure on Seoul, publicly criticising the Yoon administration's pro-US stance, particularly his pursuit of close security alignment with the US and Japan. In June, China's ambassador to South Korea Xing Haiming was caught in a diplomatic row when he warned that Seoul would “definitely regret it” if it bet against Beijing in the US-China rivalry.

;

;Apart from Yoon's pivot towards the US, Zhu said China's Wolf Warrior-diplomacy in dealing with South Korea, especially following Seoul's deployment of a US missile defence system known as THAAD in 2016, had also had negative impacts on bilateral ties.

;

;“Following Japan's lead, South Korea has accepted that its security and strategic concerns trump other issues, including business and economic interests,” he said.

;

;Benoit Hardy-Chartrand, an international affairs specialist at Temple University Japan in Tokyo, said Yoon's election in South Korea was the key factor in bringing the three countries together.

;

;“Without [Yoon's] willingness to reach out to Japan despite the political risks it entailed, none of this would have been possible,” he said.

;

;“This highlights the potential fragility of the trilateral partnership. While we cannot ignore the geopolitical variables that brought them together, this partnership remains liable to the vagaries of domestic politics in South Korea and, to a lesser extent, Japan.”

;

;He noted that if a candidate from the progressive opposition, which is traditionally more anti-Japanese, won the 2027 presidential election in South Korea, it could “spell serious trouble for trilateral cooperation”.

;

;Hardy-Chartrand added that the other factors behind the summit included North Korea's repeated missile provocations, Russia's invasion of Ukraine and a shared perception among regional countries of a growing challenge posed by China.

;

;“We cannot understate how significant the Camp David summit was. Leaders often tend to overhype such diplomatic events in order to score domestic points, but in this case, bringing the three leaders together for the first Japan-South Korea-US stand-alone summit was not only a diplomatic success for Biden, but also a sign of the widening fractures in regional geopolitics,” he said.

;

;Zhiqun Zhu, an international relations professor from Bucknell University in Pennsylvania, said the summit served to underline that the world was being divided into two Cold War-style camps, with the US and its allies on one side, and China, other authoritarian regimes and some developing countries on the other.

;

;“As the Biden administration galvanises support from its allies in Europe and Asia in competing with China, tensions will not only grow between the US and China, but also between China and its Asian neighbours,” he said.

;

;“As a result, East Asia will become more unstable, and the dangers of conflict in the Taiwan Strait and the South China Sea will increase.”

;

;Zhu cautioned against what he called “a misguided belief” among the US and its allies that by strengthening security alliances, China would be deterred on issues such as Taiwan and the South China Sea.

;

;Why US-Japan-South Korea cooperation should trouble China

;

;“This miscalculation unfortunately underestimates China's will and preparedness to defend what it considers 'core' national interests,” he said.

;

;In response to the US, he said we could see China consolidate its relationships with Russia and other countries in its own circles, such as the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation and Brics, which held a summit in Johannesburg this week.

;

;However, he said China should take a long view and wait for political changes in the US, South Korea and Japan before taking any action.

;

;“After all, Biden may be out of office after the 2024 election, and approval ratings of both Yoon and Kishida are lacklustre at home. Nevertheless, it is unwise for China to confront the US head-on now, especially when Beijing is facing serious domestic challenges now,” Zhu said.

;

;Lee pointed to a possible weakness of the partnership: the three leaders' focus primarily on security “at a time when people are more concerned about the economy”.

;

;“If these moves do not yield economic benefits, they risk facing domestic political backlash,” he said, adding that the leaders were trying to advance an economic partnership that complemented their security cooperation.

;

;Kim Hyun-wook, a professor at Korea National Diplomatic Academy, also said domestic politics, especially leadership reshuffles, remained the biggest challenge for the trilateral partnership.

;

;“If Trump wins the election [next year], the future of trilateral cooperation will be opaque, because Trump's keynote is America first and isolationism,” he said. “The historical issue between South Korea and Japan will also rise back to the surface if Seoul has a regime change to progressive government.”

;

;Kim also said that despite China's frustration, it was unlikely to retaliate against Japan and South Korea due to economic difficulties and concerns about a public opinion backlash in both countries. He added that besides the North Korea factor, China's hardline diplomacy with South Korea and Japan had also played a big role in pushing them into the arms of America.

;

;Hardy-Chartrand agreed that China's heavy-handed approach to South Korean relations was partly to blame for the situation.

;

;“Beijing could until recently be comforted by the fact that South Korea was keen to maintain strong ties with China, in large part due to its economic dependence on its neighbour. But now that Seoul appears poised to move away from its traditional equidistance to Beijing and Washington, this is a blow to Chinese efforts to forge a favourable geopolitical environment and pry away American allies,” he said.

;

;Additional reporting by Seong Hyeon Choi

;A gunman in Jacksonville, Florida driven by racial hatred shot dead three black people in a discount store on Saturday before killing himself after a stand-off with police, authorities said.

;

;“He targeted a certain group of people and that's black people.这就是他说的他想杀掉的人。 And that's very clear,” Jacksonville Sheriff TK Waters told a news conference about the gunman, who was white and in his early 20s.

;

;According to the sheriff's office, the shooter, who has not yet been identified, entered the Dollar General store wearing a tactical vest, armed with an AR-style rifle and a handgun.

;

;Manifestos discovered by the gunman's family soon before the attack “detail the shooter's disgusting ideology of hate,” Waters said, and at least one of the guns had hand-drawn swastikas on it.

;

;The sheriff said the gunman committed the shooting because it was the fifth anniversary of when another gunman opened fire during a video game tournament in Jacksonville, killing two people before fatally shooting himself.

;

;The shooting took place near Edward Waters University, a historically black college in the southern US state.

;

;University students were being kept in their dorms, the school said in a statement. No students or faculty are believed involved, the school said.

;

;The shooter had driven to Jacksonville from neighbouring Clay County.袭击发生前不久，枪手给他的父亲发了一条短信，让他检查电脑。 The father found the writings and the family notified 911, but the shooting had already begun, Sheriff Waters said.

;

;“This is a dark day in Jacksonville's history.这个社区没有仇恨的容身之地，”警长说。 “我对这个懦弱的射手的个人意识形态感到恶心。” He said the investigation will continue and that the shooter's home is being searched.

;

;Mayor Donna Deegan said she is “heartbroken.”

;

;“This is a community that has suffered again and again.很多时候，这就是我们最终的结局，”迪根说。 “This is something that should not and must not continue to happen in our community.”

;

;The FBI would investigate the shooting as a hate crime, said Sherri Onks, the bureau's special agent for Jacksonville.

;

;Florida Governor Ron DeSantis decried the “horrific” shooting and called the gunman a “scumbag.”

;

;Who killed Tupac Shakur? Search warrant served by Las Vegas police

;

;“He was targeting people based on their race, that is totally unacceptable,” said DeSantis, who is competing to be the Republican Party's candidate for the 2024 White House race.

;

;“This guy killed himself rather than face the music and accept responsibility for his actions and so he took the coward's way out.”

;

;The shooting was the latest in a spate of gun violence this weekend in the United States.

;

;Mass shootings have become disturbingly common across the United States, with easy access to firearms in most states and more guns in the country than citizens.

;

;Earlier in the day at least seven people were hospitalised after a mass shooting at a Caribbean festival in the northeast city of Boston, police said.

;

;Meanwhile, two women were shot at a baseball game in Chicago the night before.

;

;That same night a 16-year-old was shot dead and four others hurt after an argument erupted at a high school football game in Oklahoma, local police said.

;

;The Jacksonville shooting comes after a self-declared white supremacist killed 10 black people in a live-streamed shooting rampage at a supermarket in the US state of New York in May 2022.

;

;Payton Gendron planned the attack for months, targeting Tops Friendly Market in Buffalo because of the large African-American population in the surrounding neighbourhood. He pleaded guilty to the killings in November.
